10006.description: MJHS Hospice provides a specialized program of care and services for end-of-life patients. MJHS Hospice provides care for pediatric and adult patients in homes, nursing homes, assisted living communities, inpatient facilities and hospitals. MJHS Hospice Volunteer opportunities include: Providing support and companionship to patients and their families Participating in leisure activities such as reading, listening to music, playing games with patients Supporting or organizing group activities for patients Listening compassionately to patients and their families Providing office or clerical support for our hospice team Complementary therapies Requirements for all categories of volunteers: 18 years or older 15 hours of training (4 hours training for clerical/office volunteers) Background Check (no charge to applicant) Medical Clearance (no charge to applicant) 3-4 hours per week 1 year commitment Required skills for patient visits: discretion, patience, compassion and dedication Preferred clerical and office support skills include: receptionist skills, computer skills, organizational skills and filing For more information on how to become a MJHS Hospice Volunteer please call: Director of Volunteer Services, Patricia Cusack at 212-649-8903 or email pcusack@mjhs.org.
10006.title: Be Part of Someone's Legacy--Become a Hospice Volunteer !

07960.description: Children on the Green (childrenonthegreen.org) is a licensed, non-profit child care center committed to quality care and early education for children of families living or working in the Morristown area. We reflect the diversity of the Morristown community and are committed to partnerships that support all children and families regardless of income. In the last 25 years, we have provided scholarships to hundreds of families living in shelters and low-income families using government vouchers. In order to continue to serve our community during the COVID crisis we need to operate in compliance with additional rules intended to minimize the risk of COVID transmission. We are converting two previously unused rooms into classrooms to comply with the social distancing regulations and with the additional childcare needed due to hybrid schedules and remote learning. Children on the Green is seeking a few volunteers aged 17 to 99 to help paint two classrooms about 800 sq feet each. All paint, supplies and tools will be provided. Volunteers will be asked to wear masks and to observe social distancing. To do: Cover carpet Small sheetrock repair in one room Wipe down/dust walls as needed Paint walls Paint heater covers Time and duration: Work can start as early as Tuesday September 2 and must be finished by September 18. Daytime hours, sometime between 7:00 am and 5:15 pm are preferred Evening or weekend hours only if necessary We are located in the heart of Morristown, behind the United Methodist Church.
07960.title: Children's organization needs helping hand with a paint can

07480.description: Need safety repairs of pipes, furnaces, bathrooms, etc. Thank you.
07480.title: New Jersey licensed Plumber Needed!

07480.description: Please lend your much-appreciated expertise for a one-day project as soon as possible! We want a pad poured for children tricycling in West Milford. We need new footings for damaged pillars in Wanaque. Thank you. Please call Betsy 862.200.5125.
07480.title: Concrete work need experienced mason for small job

10001.description: Institute for Immigrant Concerns, a not-for-profit providing ESOL classes for adult immigrants and refugees, started in 1997, is looking for ESL instructors. Must have Bachelor's or MA Degree and at least 2 years of English teaching experience (whether domestic or abroad). Our students are all motivated and studious adults. We put great emphasis on survival English, employment and cross-cultural awareness. Applicants should be available twice a week, on Tuesdays and Thursdays for our morning/evening classes ( 9am-10:30am/6-8:30pm). We are currently looking for ESL teachers for an 8-week session, and welcome anyone with the potential of teaching future cycles. Applicants must send us a copy of their resume and a brief cover letter.
10001.title: ESL Teachers for Adult Immigrants

10001.description: In an effort to ensure the continued health and safety of those homeless men and women we serve, we have started providing pre-packaged meal delivery. In order to keep up with our other food service obligations, we occasionally seek assistance in the packaging process. Please note, all volunteers must wash hands frequently throughout their shift, and wear gloves and masks at all times. This will take place at our 25th street kitchen, between 6th and 7th Avenues. Due to space and social distancing requirements, spots are limited. Available shifts are seven days per week as follows: 9am to 10:30am 1:30pm to 3:30pm If you are interested in lending a hand with this effort, please reach out for more details. Please note: Any/all potential volunteers must complete a New Volunteer Registration form, which can be found at the following link: http://www.brc.org/volunteer-registration . Once received, you will then be sent an invitation to participate in an orientation via Zoom.
10001.title: Help Pre-package Meals for Those Less Fortunate - MANHATTAN

10001.description: In an effort to ensure the continued health and safety of those homeless men and women we serve, we have started providing pre-packaged meal delivery. In order to keep up with our other food service obligations, we occasionally seek assistance in the packaging process. Please note, all volunteers must wash hands frequently throughout their shift, and wear gloves and masks at all times. This will take place at our 25th street kitchen, between 6th and 7th Avenues. Due to space and social distancing requirements, spots are limited. Available shifts are seven days per week as follows: 9am to 10:30am 1:30pm to 3:30pm If you are interested in lending a hand with this effort, please reach out for more details. Please note: Any/all potential volunteers must complete a New Volunteer Registration form, which can be found at the following link: http://www.brc.org/volunteer-registration . Once received, you will then be sent an invitation to participate in an orientation via Zoom.
10001.title: Help Pre-package Meals for Those Less Fortunate - MANHATTAN

07003.description: Please consider giving up two hours of your time each week to help an adult learn to read, write and speak English. Share your gift of literacy with our upcoming workshop: The workshop will be remote and tutoring will start that way too, ,once libraries reopen, we ask tutors to meet students in person. Remote Training, by Barbara Hathaway Platform: Zoom Thursdays, 6:30-8:30pm October 1st, 8th, 15th, 22nd & 29, 2020 To start, you can register through this link: http://www.lvaep.org/forms.html. Please email the forms back to me at emartin@lvaep.org. A copy of our monthly newsletter can be found at http://www.lvaep.org/august-2020.html
07003.title: Become a Literacy Volunteer!
07003.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

07702.description: Unleash your creative side! Join us for our Window Decorating event! Share some cheer and encouragement with the residents at Brookdale Hillsborough Assisted Living Facility by drawing on the outside of their windows with washable window markers! Join us as we decorate the glass with art and encouraging messages. Materials will be provided! Fun for all ages! Thursday, September 10th, 2020 from 10am-11am The Chelsea at Shrewsbury 515 Shrewsbury Avenue, Shrewsbury NJ 07702 We will remain outside, wear masks, and practice social distancing to adhere with safety guidelines! We hope you will join us! RSVP to MaryBeth Moynihan at 732-318-9564 or Volunteer@Gracehcs.com
07702.title: Volunteers Needed for window decorating event!

10029.description: We need a Volunteer to help us breakdown delivery boxes during our food pantry hours. We are seeing nearly 600 people on Wednesdays, and we have constant need for someone to break down cardboard boxes during the time the pantry is open. Must be in good physical condition, and willing to break down boxes so we have a constant open flow in our space. For more information, please contact the Volunteer Director tgough@lsafhs.org
10029.title: Wednesday Volunteer to Help Breakdown Boxes during our Pantry Hours

10029.description: We need an English/Chinese (Mandarin) fully bilingual volunteer to assist us in our food pantry line, assisting with translation for our Chinese clients. May also help translate signs, other translation assistance as may be needed when our food pantry is open to the public on Wednesdays, serving nearly 600 clients. For more information, please email tgough@lsafhs.org
10029.title: Chinese/English Speaker Needed for Translation Assistance in our Food Pantry line

10029.description: We need a volunteer Security Guard to assist on the food pantry line, to help keep order and deescalate tense situations that have been arising in the last weeks. We are serving over 500 people a day, and some of the clients can be aggressive towards staff/volunteers, and we have had to call the police. This position is good for a retired police officer or a trained security guard, or even for someone who has worked as a bouncer. Able to handle difficult, aggressive individuals without force. Bilingual helpful, but not necessary. For more details, please send your resume/letter of interest to tgough@lsafhs.org
10029.title: Volunteer Security Guard Needed to Assist on our food pantry line

10024.description: Drop off a package and share warmth & companionship over the phone with an older neighbor this Rosh Hashanah! Pick up a package of treats outside the DOROT office and drop it off at the door of an older neighbor on the UWS of Manhattan (between West 60th St.-West 125th St.). After you make your drop off, c all the senior you delivered to by phone to share stories, memories, and good wishes. Dates: Thurs., Sept. 10th - 12pm-1:40pm or 4pm-5:40pm Fri., Sept. 11th - 10am-11:40am or 1pm-2:40pm Sun., Sept. 13th - 10am-11:40am or 1pm-2:40pm Volunteers are asked to register for an individual time slot within the time frames indicated above. To register for this program, please click here - https://form.jotform.com/201884875963169 The package pickup location is: DOROT 171 W. 85th St. (off Amsterdam Ave.) New York, NY 10024 Please note that pre-registration and a Photo ID are required to participate. All volunteers must be aged 18-64, wear face coverings throughout the duration of participation and meet DOROTʼs COVID-19 Safety Guidelines. For more information, please email volunteers@dorotusa.org.
10024.title: Rosh Hashanah Package Delivery & 9/11 National Day of Service and Remembrance

10024.description: Each school year DOROT welcomes approximately 100 high school students in ninth through twelfth grade who come to DOROT to experience the benefits of intergenerational relationships and hone their leadership skills. Volunteers and teens are provided the all-too-rare opportunity to be together and enjoy one another’s company. Join a teen-led discussion group, engage in small group creative arts programming, or, sign up for a weekly virtual chess match with a teen.
10024.title: Virtual Volunteering for Adults 65+

10577.description: Support a world with out Alzheimer's by joining our Volunteer team and help to plan our Westchester County Walk to End Alzheimer's! Jobs include: Setting out signage Setting up and running water stations Being a photographer Helping register walkers Being a greeter Helping at food tables And much more Sign up at Westchesterwalk.org. Call or email Mark at 914.253.6860 at mtholcomb@alz.org for more information or to sign up.
10577.title: Westchester Walk to End Alzheimer's - Day of Event Volunteers

10970.description: Are you interested in getting more involved in the fight to end Alzheimer's? Join us at the Walk to End Alzheimer's as a volunteer to help make strides to end this disease. Jobs include: Setting out signage Setting up and running water stations Being a photographer Helping register walkers Being a greeter Helping at food tables And much more Sign up at hudsonvalleywalks.org. Call or email Kellee Thelman at 845-695-2247 at kgthelman@alz.orgfor more information or to sign up.
10970.title: Rockland - Walk to End Alzheimer's  Event Day Volunteer

07728.description: Unleash your creative side! Join us for our Window Decorating event! Share some cheer and encouragement with the residents at Brookdale Hillsborough Assisted Living Facility by drawing on the outside of their windows with washable window markers! Join us as we decorate the glass with art and encouraging messages. Materials will be provided! Fun for all ages! Wednesday, September 9th, 2020 from 10am-11am Mattison Crossing 93 Manalapan Avenue, Freehold NJ We will remain outside, wear masks, and practice social distancing to adhere with safety guidelines! We hope you will join us! RSVP to MaryBeth Moynihan at 732-318-9564
07728.title: Volunteers Needed for window decorating event!

07501.description: Now organizing a team to clean then photograph the Knapp mural panels. Currently working with building owner to permit access for the project. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g6r8WpX04X8 Knapp mural is actually over 260 tiles. These tiles are in the museum's storage in temporary space is right off route 19 and 80 on Spruce street in Paterson; its also known as the Art Factory. The Bergen Museum's mural once hung on the Alexander's dept. store on route 4 and 17. It was created by Stefan Knapp and the museum needs volunteers to help clean the panels in preparation of a Knapp Mural Panel Exhibit. Volunteers that are able to assist in this project please contact me. We'd like to have things in place so that when we can have access we have a team in place.
07501.title: Clean & Photograph Stefan Knapp 260 Alexander Mural Panels
07501.org: Bergen Museum of Art and Science

07501.description: Paterson, NJ, is a densely populated urban center with significant economic and societal challenges. To address the ongoing disparities that plague the city and its citizenry, additional Federal assistance will be needed. One measure to ensure that this assistance is available to Paterson is completion of the 2020 Census. Paterson's Census response rate is currently 49.2%. Fewer than half of all Paterson households have completed the 2020 Census. We need to do better. St. Paul's Community Development Corporation (SPCDC) is lending its support to this effort by recruiting volunteers willing to assist helping our Food Pantry recipients with completing the online Census form. Volunteers would staff an information table outside our Food Pantry where pantry recipients line up to receive their grocery packages. Available Shifts: 9 a.m. to 11 a.m. - Monday to Friday (closed during inclement weather events and on Federal holidays) All Centers for Disease Control guidelines for social distancing and safety will be employed to keep volunteers and participants safe. Bilingual volunteers (English/Spanish) are encouraged to sign-up.
07501.title: Census Enumerator (Volunteer)

11367.description: Queens College Speech Society is the speech and debate program at Queens College. We are hosting a debate tournament on Sunday, Sept 27th, 2020. This tournament will be an online competition taking place on Yaatly.com - a new and revolutionary virtual debating platform. The team is looking volunteers to judge debate rounds at our upcoming debate tournament on Sunday, Sept 27th, 2020. Our tournament will be offering three formats of debate, which are International Public Debate (IPDA), Parliamentary Debate (NPDA), and Lincoln-Douglas Debate (NFA-LD). We will provide virtual training for those who are interested in judging debate rounds! Those who are judging must attend the training to participate! We will hold a judge training session on Saturday, August 15th at 3PM on Zoom. You can access the meeting code on Google Meets: https://meet.google. com/udz-wfeu-stj I encourage you to visit our website at https://www.qcspeechsociety.com/ to find more about who we are and what we will be doing. You do not need previous experience in public speaking, debate, or acting to volunteer. Just email me and I will be happy to receive you. Thanks.
11367.title: Volunteer Judges for Upcoming Debate Tournament

07465.description: #1 Most important: Please, fix flashing around a vent from the stove. It is a flat roof. It leaks into pails in the kitchen when it rains now! 2. Please, rehang some fallen gutter leaders so we don't keep getting 'waterfalls' from gaps in the duct work when it rains! Thank you. 3. If you are into it, we can secure some plants onto flat roof too.
07465.title: Roof Work on flat roof

07465.description: Pull up peel and stick tiles, 23 x 43. Put in plywood subfloor. Put down new tile system. For a children's learning center, serving essential workers' children. Reliability is more important than if you've ever done this! Individual or group. Thank you.
07465.title: Replace tile flooring

06854.description: If you are looking for a way to give back in the community, please consider our outdoor Farmer's Market as a (gloved, social distanced) hands-on opportunity to make a difference. Volunteers who can give us one or two hours on one or more Wednesdays between 10:45 am and 3 pm are needed this summer and fall to ensure vendors and shoppers are observing social distancing, mask, and hand sanitizing protocols, to staff information tables with nutritional information, and lend a hand during our COVID19-modified Healthy Back to School and Eating Well days during national Health Center Week in August. Bilingual Spanish/English desirable but not required. Volunteers will be provided with masks and gloves. Our Market will be opening for the 2020 season on Wednesday, July 8 and will return every Wednesday from 11 am to 3 pm until Thanksgiving. Norwalk Community Health Center hosts a public Farmer's Market in its parking lot every Wednesday in season. It has provided access to fresh fruit, vegetables, eggs, honey, and plants for the past 10 years and fills an important and growing need for our patients and in our neighborhood. The Health Center's Farmer's Market voucher program, funded by individual contributions and support from Newman's Own Foundation, Harvard Pilgrim Health Care and others makes fresh produce more affordable as well more accessible to food-insecure patients by stretching their food dollars. More than 300 patient families used these vouchers to shop at our Farmer’s Market for seasonal local produce in 2019. Given the spike in unemployment and underemployment that has affected our patients in greater proportion that the rest of the community, we anticipate an even busier season in 2020. Corporate, Faith-based or other Groups - together or with one or more members rotating from week to week- are welcome.
06854.title: Weekly Farmer's Market

11724.description: Volunteer for United Cerebral Palsy of Long Island! Our annual golf outing, originally planned for June, has been rescheduled for September 17 and relocated to the gorgeous Cold Spring Country Club! Spend the day with a wonderful group of friends, UCP-LI staff and other volunteers as you welcome our donors and help ensure the day runs smoothly. Volunteer tasks include: checking guests in as they arrive, selling raffle tickets, manning the \"prize\" holes on the golf course, prepping the main ballroom for cocktails/dinner, selling chances on a LUCKY DAY board, etc. This is a very fun, very fast-paced day. The best part? You will feel GREAT knowing you donated your time to UCP-LI and supported our important mission of helping people with disabilities live a life without limits. Dress code is \"golf\" comfortable: khaki's and a white shirt. Breakfast, lunch and dinner are included. Students 18 years+ are welcome. So are golf enthusiasts and anyone looking to support a wonderful organization and have a great day! Thank you!
11724.title: 2020 Golf Classic
11724.org: UNITED CEREBRAL PALSY ASSOCIATION OF LONG ISLAND INC

11211.description: Who We Are Rescuing Leftover Cuisine is a 501(c)3 non-profit focused on providing a reliable food rescue service by fostering community connections to reduce food waste and food insecurity. What We Do We partner with licensed food vendors (offices, restaurants, etc) who know they will have excess, wholesome cuisine and link their food donations to a human service agency within their local community. We then provide volunteer Food Rescuers to collect that excess food on a weekly (sometimes daily!), recurring basis, and walk it to the human service agency to help feed individuals who could benefit from a good meal!! Who We Need YOU!! RLC is currently seeking passionate and committed leaders who are willing to take on the role of Core Rescuer and lead 5 food rescue events on a weekly, recurring basis! Each event typically lasts around 30-60 minutes on any day of the week, and the average number of volunteers you would be working with is three. As a Core Rescuer, you will use your (R)esourcefulness, (L)eadership, and (C)ommunication skills to ensure that the rescued food arrives at its destination safely while providing a positive and supportive experience for all volunteers assisting you on your event. If you are able to commit to leading the same 5 food rescue events per week, you will receive compensation in the form of an unlimited monthly MetroCard in order to reimburse you for your trips around the city! Must be 18 years or older.
11211.title: FIGHT FOOD WASTE AND HUNGER IN WILLIAMSBURG !

07203.description: This year, we're getting creative and giving you several exciting options to determine how you want to come together as a community (in person or in spirit!), and celebrate how your commitment to raising vital funds for people with autism is making a real difference today and every day. On Sunday, October 4, 2020, we will host the Autism Speaks Walk on Wheels - an organized interactive car parade and festival driven by kindness. Inspired by the car parades that have brought joy to so many during these times of social distancing, we are offering this option to convene our community, while safely spread apart, as we hit the road to celebrate together. Volunteer opportunities will be as contactless as possible. Volunteers will be asked to wear a mask at all times. Gloves will be provided if wanted.
07203.title: 2020 Autism Speaks Union and Morris County Walk on Wheels

10037.description: Do you want to join the fight against hunger? Amid COVID 19 crisis food emergency needs have sky rocketed. We are handing out over 300 meals every week. Come on down to the Kennedy Center in Harlem. We are looking for 4-5 friendly volunteers to help us with food distribution and stocking our shelves. Schedule: Tuesdays, 9-12pm Group size: 1-5 volunteers Location: 34 W 134th St, New York, NY 10037 What you will do: Help with setup Stock and organize fresh food on our shelves. Bag food for our clients and friends waiting in our sanitized pick up zones. Smile and have fun! The Lt. Joseph P. Kennedy Jr. Memorial Center is one of New York City’s most vibrant treasures, located in the heart of Harlem. Managed and operated by Catholic Charities Community Services since 1954, Kennedy Center is a resource center for the community. Our goal is to provide help for individuals and families in need, and create hope. COVID 19 policy Upon arrival please wear a face mask. All staff members will wear a face covering and we are asking the public to arrive with one as well. TIP- You can bring a second mask to change into. Please use all hand sanitizing stations frequently.
10037.title: URGENT Lt. Joseph Kennedy Center: Food Pantry Volunteers (Harlem)
10037.org: Catholic Charities of the Archdiocese of New York

07201.description: Are you an aspiring marketing student looking to make a difference at a nonprofit organization this Fall? Are you looking to gain professional experience across social media platforms and trying to hone your marketing skills? Do you have an interest in helping children in the foster system? CASA of Union County’s Marketing Intern position may be exactly what you are looking for! Every year more than half a million abused and neglected children are in need of safe, permanent, nurturing homes. Too many spend years moving from one temporary home to another. They are more likely than other children to face homelessness, unemployment, even prison as adults. CASA was created to make sure the abuse and neglect these children originally suffered at home doesn't continue as abuse and neglect at the hands of the system. CASA trains advocates who are appointed by judges to be a voice for these children in court. The result is that a child is placed into a safe, loving home where he or she can thrive. Our marketing and development team makes sure that the organization has the resources necessary to do this critical work. CASA of Union County is looking for a college or graduate student to volunteer this Fall to help the marketing and development team continue to make CASA thrive. The student would commit to working approximately 10-15 hours per week from September through early December. Duties may include: creating social media posts assisting in maintaining and updating the organization website drafting articles for the monthly newsletter researching press opportunities submitting press releases assisting at recruitment events (if in-person recruitment is an option due to Covid-19) helping promote, prepare for and assist during such upcoming events as the virtual Gala, and exploring potential grant opportunities. Potential volunteers should have a passion for helping children, understand and have experience with various social media platforms including Facebook, Twitter and Instagram, and have excellent written communication and research skills. Please note: We hope this internship will be on-site in our Elizabeth office. However, if current Covid-19 health and safety concerns preclude that possibility, the position can be fully remote if necessary.
07201.title: Fall and Spring Marketing Internships at CASA of Union County

10016.description: Help make kindness - to ourselves and to our communities - a habit by practicing an act of kindness each day from September 1st to September 21st! Select 'Sign Up' on this page and we’ll send you all the information you need to get started, including a social media toolkit to help spread the word online and suggestions for kind acts you can do for yourself and others from some of our amazing partners + special guests. You can participate as an individual or you can assemble a Kindness Team by inviting your friends, family, coworkers, classroom, book club, neighborhood (...you get the idea) to join you.
10016.title: Pledge to #BeKind21!

07073.description: The success of Autism Speaks Walk depends on the dedication and support of its volunteers. Volunteers assist in many capacities - set up, registration (reserved for volunteers 19+ years or older), t-shirt tent, resfreshment tent, providing encouragement at water stops, kids activities and cleaning up after the event. You can recruit friends, family and coworkers to join you! Available shifts are: Set-up - 7:00am - 9:00am Walk - 8:00am - 12:00pm Event breakdown - 10:00am - approx. 11:30am Feel free to pick one or two shifts, or volunteer all day! Visit the following link to learn more about the Autism Speaks NNJ Walk http://act.autismspeaks.org/site/TR/Walk/NewJersey?fr_id=4808&pg=entry
07073.title: 2020 Autism Speaks Northern New Jersey Walk on Wheels

08807.description: Recruit, mentor and support a group of volunteers and organize adult trainings and activities in your local area for girl and volunteers. Responsible for the Girl Scout program and membership in a given geographic area. Host virtual meetings bi-monthly.
08807.title: Share your wisdom with local Girl Scout volunteers!
08807.org: Girl Scouts Heart of New Jersey

08807.description: The Arc Foundation of Somerset County is hosting the \"Clubs for Cabins\" 3rd Annual Golf Fundraiser on Monday, September 14, 2020, at the Raritan Valley Country Club. Proceeds from this event will support the Camp Jotoni Capital Campaign. Camp Jotoni provides summer recreational services for children and adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. We are in need of volunteers to assist with the event. Volunteers can volunteer for one or all three 'shifts' 9:00 am to 12:00 pm - Set Up and Registration 12:00 pm to 3:00 pm - Pre-Evening Set Up Activity 5:00 pm to 8:00 pm - Program Reception and Silent Auction and Wrap up Volunteers will be notified of their assignments/duties prior to the day of the event. Some duties will include: Checking Guest in at registration table Taking pictures on the course/reception and light social media work Help running some of the contests Set up and break down of the event For more information about the event go to https://www.thearcofsomerset.org/events/ For more information about our capital campaign watch this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0hv_8Dy2ooA
08807.title: Volunteers Needed for 3rd Annual Camp Jotoni Golf Outing

08807.description: Help an adult learn to read, write, and communicate in English. Become a literacy tutor! All activities conducted virtually during the pandemic. First, attend a Virtual Information Session to Learn More. Upcoming Information Sessions are scheduled as follows: Thursday, August 13, 2020: 7 - 8 pm Wednesday, August 26, 2020: 4 - 5 pm To register for a Information Session Zoom link, click here http://www.literacysomerset.org/index.php/contact-us. Next, Complete the Virtual Tutor Training Workshop: Attend four (4) Zoom sessions (Fridays, Sept. 11, 18, 25, Oct. 2, 2020; 3-4:30 pm) Complete 4 online training modules prior to each training session. Upon completion of training, tutors will be matched with an adult students in need of ESL tutoring. Tutoring is usually held at the local libraries in Somerset County, but during the pandemic, tutoring will be done virtually. To learn more: Visit: LiteracySomerset.org Call: (908) 725-5430 Email: info@literacysomerset.org
08807.title: Become a Literacy Tutor - VIRTUAL OPPORTUNITY

08807.description: A LUNG FORCE Walk or Run/Walk is like no other charity event. With an inspiring signature song and music, we will celebrate the collective power of our breath. Our voices will soar as we rally our friends, neighbors and colleagues to stand together, and walk together, against lung cancer--and for lung health for all. Every day, we rely on our lungs to breathe, speak, sing, and laugh. At every LUNG FORCE Walk, we’ll use our lungs to do all these things, and to power our bodies along the course. We’ll also raise funds for research, advocacy, education and awareness. The more money we raise and the harder we work, the more we can help improve the quality of life for people living with lung cancer and other lung diseases, discover more successful treatments--and save lives.
08807.title: Join the LUNG FORCE Walk
08807.org: American Lung Association in New Jersey

11793.description: Put your passion to work as a Making Strides Against Breast Cancer Volunteer. Breast cancer is a personal cause to many people. Perhaps you have personally faced the disease or you have had friends or family members who have. Volunteers are the heart of the American Cancer Society and events like Making Strides walks simply could not happen without you. Your support will bring you community together with determination, hope, empathy, caring, and passion, so no one has to walk alone. The American Cancer Society Making Strides Against Breast Cancer walks raise awareness and funds to save lives from breast cancer. Each event is a noncompetitive 5 mile walk that brings people together to make a difference for everyone who has been touched by breast cancer. The events raise money to fund innovative research, provide free information and support, and to help people reduce their breast cancer risk or find it early when it's most treatable. From the opening ceremony to the post-walk entertainment, a Making Strides event is a celebration of survivors and opportunity to remember loved-ones lost. It's a day that shouldn't be missed and won't be forgotten. For more information please visit www.makingstrideswalk.org/longisland or email Christine.haskell@cancer.org On your email please have your name ( first and last ), Your email address, phone number, alone with your mailing address. Opportunity Areas: Include but not limited to: *Set-up (Saturday October 17,2020) *Breakdown (Sunday October 18th, 2020) *General Event Volunteer *Check-In *Tent Volunteer *Refreshment Distribution *Route Cheerleader *Water Station(s) *Merchandise Sales *Stage Entertainment *Face Painting *Temporary Tattoo *Survivor Masseuse *Hair Decorator
11793.title: 10/18/2020 Event Volunteer - Making Strides Against Breast Cancer Walk 10/18/2020

07470.description: In only 7 - 12 hours per month, you can make a difference in a child's life as a volunteer advocate. Children enter foster care for a variety of reasons: abuse, medical or physical neglect, abandonment, etc. When they enter foster care, these children are often confused, scared, and lonely. Each and every one of them deserves a dedicated, compassionate advocate to help them navigate the difficult child welfare system. No specific background or education is needed to become a volunteer advocate. Passaic County CASA will provide all needed training and resources. The first step to becoming a volunteer is to attend our next volunteer information session, which will be held via Zoom on Saturday, September 12, 10 - 11 a.m. Learn about the volunteer program, the foster care system, and the CASA training. Please RSVP here if you plan to attend: https://www.passaiccountycasa.org/virtual-info-sessions
07470.title: Volunteer as an advocate for children in foster care
07470.org: CASA for Children of Passaic County

07470.description: In only 7 - 12 hours per month, you can make a difference in a child's life as a volunteer bilingual advocate. More than fifty percent of children in the Passaic County foster care system identify as Hispanic. Unfortunately, there is a serious shortage of bilingual English/Spanish volunteers to advocate for their rights. When a child enters foster care, he or she is assigned a dedicated, trained Court Appointed Special Advocate (CASA) volunteer from Passaic County CASA. The child’s advocate ensures that their individual needs remain priority while they move through the child welfare system and the family court. CASAs work one-on-one with the abused or neglected child, gathering information from the family, caretakers, teachers, doctors, and caseworkers in order to make informed recommendations to the family court about the child’s future. The first step to becoming a volunteer is to attend our next volunteer information session, which will be held via Zoom on Thursday, September 24, 10 - 11 a.m. Learn about the volunteer program, the foster care system, and the CASA training. RSVP here: https://zoom.us/meeting/register/tJwvdO2hqT4sHdKkGxC5k4yeaMNhmD5h19yz
07470.title: ¿Hablas español? Children in foster care NEED you
07470.org: CASA for Children of Passaic County

08844.description: Unleash your creative side! Join us for our Window Decorating event! Share some cheer and encouragement with the residents at Brookdale Hillsborough Assisted Living Facility by drawing on the outside of their windows with washable window markers! Join us as we decorate the glass with art and encouraging messages. Materials will be provided! Fun for all ages! Thursday, September 3rd, 2020 from 11am-12pm Brookdale Hillsborough 600 Auten Road, Hillsborough We will remain outside, wear masks, and practice social distancing to adhere with safety guidelines! We hope you will join us! RSVP to Mary Ellen Day at 732-439-1086
